text: I love it as I love all of them but right now I cant really elaborate because I just think this is awesome

text: Me too!

text: I am so pro-this. I want that watch.

name: fuckyoufriday
text: Naturally, Ray gravitates towards manly alcoholic authors.

name: contrasoma
text: Indeed.  I'd love to read the Raymond Carver one.

name: shirt145
text: Ray finally woke up. He didn't wonder where she was.

name: snowman
text: do you think it is rad to gravitate towards authors with alcoholism ray

name: madnes
text: A comment left by madnes was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Jesus, jimbob, lateadopter)

name: catachresis
text: This strip makes me feel so guilty for not getting it. I am a badly read man.

name: slab64
text: Ditto to that. Maybe if this comic were less hilarious, I could get other stuff done.

name: jaldor
text: You are a poorly read man.

name: billyamericana
text: I look forward to the day when all authors are reduced to word-compiling algorithms to generate blocks of text about whatever you want. I'd have Robert Frost make me a sonnet about "how tasty is the bacon" and Shakespeare make a one-act about the dangers of critical hyperbole.

name: katsura
text: the only thing I'd wish for for mine is for Palahniuk to write a chapter around my driving lessons

name: charchar
text: It would turn out your driving instructor with whom you'd imagined a torrid affair was really your 'dead' brother in drag and you had rabies.

name: charchar
text: <--Mega<3 Palahniuk and his Ted Bundy-looking portrait.

name: lux
text: The book would be called 'Drag' and it would be a wordplay on drag racing and flexible sexuality.

name: stereo
text: NO MORAL

name: zem
text: I love the strips that are about writing

name: crinklebat
text: Funny, I love the ones that are about coding! I guess that Achewood speaks to everyone in a Typing and/or Drinking profession.

name: tehvirus
text: I personally love the ones about food, which it's definitely not lacking.

name: tekende
text: I love the ones about the depressed cat and the alcoholic cat and the old bear and the childish otter.

name: leon_sumbitches
text: I just bought an expensive watch (to me $65 is expensive) and I was proud of myself. If I had this watch, i would think that i was the king of the whole god damned world! I would probably choose Edgar allen poe as my author!

name: tetrisattack
text: A comment left by tetrisattack was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by karljw, nighttoad, alphagator, pwb, DeimosRising, equinn2006, DanS, thatcrazycommie)

name: dans
text: Oh man, I was just going to say Vonnegut was all that was missing.

text: A chubby for effort.

text:
i can't recall any other mention of said maid

this interests me greatly

name: andrew_
text:
Check his early blogs.

Then you will understand why the word "conchita" is so hilarious to me.

name: soticoto
text: Far be it from my place to note that to the best of my knowledge, Rolex don't specialise in practical watches so much as pointlessly shiny ones. The awesomeness of Ray's watch is simply amplified by every aspect of its impossibility.

name: surviveinc
text: oh Bukowski

text: IIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIII'll send flooooooooooooooooowers

name: ghost_story
text: why is there no way to send creepy myspace style messages to girls you deem "probably really cool" based on what most people might call a sparse amount of evidence? (rhetorical question)

name: anzio
text: Because then it would be too easy, instead of so fucking difficult. Is so difficult...

name: tinhand
text:
Hahahaha, beershits. Rays maid does not have the best lot in life.

Just wondering...
how does the watch know what Ray's day was like?
It must be a living entity.
